methods: sampling of the posterior probability distribution

statistically rigorous analysis.reasoning: Statistically rigorous analysis refers to the methodical approach taken to incorporate various uncertainties, ensuring that the results are reliable and valid.
passages: Our statistically rigorous analysis incorporates experimental error, computational method uncertainty, and the uncertainty due to truncation of the xEFT expansion at next-to-next-to-leading order.

eigenvector continuation.reasoning: Eigenvector continuation is a specific computational technique used for emulating no-core shell model calculations, indicating a methodological approach to the analysis of few-nucleon observables.
passages: We use eigenvector continuation for fast and accurate emulation of no-core shell model calculations of the few-nucleon observables.

sampling of the posterior probability di.reasoning: Sampling of the posterior probability distribution is a statistical method used to estimate the distributions of parameters, which is a key part of the analysis in this research.
passages: This facilitates sampling of the posterior probability distribution, allowing us to also determine the distributions of the parameters that quantify the truncation error.
